name: Starbucks College Achievement Plan
eligibility: Part- and full-time U.S. Starbucks employees (partners)
overview: In partnership with Arizona State University Online, Starbucks covers 100% tuition for eligible employees earning a first-time bachelor’s degree. Over 80 degree programs available.

name: Coca-Cola Scholars Program
eligibility: U.S. high school seniors with leadership, service, and academic excellence
overview: A prestigious achievement-based scholarship recognizing students making a significant impact on their schools and communities.

name: Taco Bell Live Más Scholarship
deadline: Opens in fall; no essay required
eligibility: U.S. residents aged 16–26, not based on GPA or test scores
overview: Submit a 2-minute video about your passion for a chance to win. Creativity encouraged—grades not required.

name: BMW Engineering Scholarship
eligibility: High school seniors planning to study engineering
overview: Offered in partnership with SAE International, this award supports future engineers who demonstrate passion for innovation and technology.

name: HireAHelper Skilled Trade & Tech Scholarship
eligibility: Students entering skilled trade fields
overview: Designed to support students pursuing in-demand trade and tech careers.

name: Dr. Pepper Tuition Giveaway
eligibility: U.S. students ages 18–24
overview: Create a short video for the chance to win major tuition money—and possibly compete on the field!

name: Doodle 4 Google
eligibility: K–12 students
overview: Submit a custom Google Doodle and win big for both yourself and your school.

name: Duck® Brand “Stuck at Prom” Contest
eligibility: High school students in the U.S. and Canada
overview: Make and wear prom attire made of duct tape for a shot at scholarship money.

name: Blacks at Microsoft Scholarship
eligibility: Black high school seniors pursuing degrees in STEM or business
overview: Encourages diversity in tech through financial support and mentorship.

name: McDonald’s® HACER® National Scholarship
eligibility: High school seniors with Hispanic heritage; academic achievement, financial need, community involvement
overview: Awarded to students who demonstrate leadership, strong academic performance, and a commitment to giving back.

name: Dell Scholars Program
eligibility: Low-income, college-bound students; GPA of 2.4+ and participation in a college readiness program
overview: More than just financial aid—the program offers mentoring, textbook credits, and a laptop to help students succeed.

name: GE-Reagan Foundation Scholarship Program
eligibility: High school seniors with strong leadership, integrity, and citizenship
overview: Renewable $10,000/year scholarship for students who embody President Reagan’s legacy of service and excellence.

name: Shell Incentive Fund Scholarship
eligibility: High school seniors planning to study engineering or geosciences at select institutions
overview: Designed to attract diverse talent to STEM fields related to the energy industry.

name: Ford Motor Company Fund
deadline: See website for programs and partners
eligibility: Typically tied to nonprofit or school-partnered programs
overview: Offers multiple scholarship opportunities through educational partners as part of its $16M+ annual education investment.

name: Discover Student Loans Scholarship Award Sweepstakes
eligibility: High school or college students (or their parents)
overview: No essay required—just enter to win. Also offers helpful college planning tools.

name: Huntington’s College Scholarship Sweepstakes
eligibility: College-bound students
overview: A simple entry form gives students a chance to win tuition funds with minimal effort.

name: Google Student Veterans of America Scholarship
eligibility: U.S. military veterans pursuing degrees in computer science or a related field
overview: A collaboration between Google and SVA to support the next generation of veteran tech professionals.

name: $2,000 Sallie Scholarship
eligibility: U.S. residents enrolling in college within the next 12 months
overview: Sallie helps students plan and pay for college. This monthly no-essay sweepstakes takes less than 2 minutes to enter and offers 12 chances per year to win.

name: $5,000 Discover Student Loans Scholarship
deadline: Rolling (12 winners selected throughout the year)
eligibility: U.S. high school or college students (or their parents)
overview: Sign up for helpful college tips from Discover and automatically enter to win a $5,000 scholarship. No essay, no fuss.

name: College Board “BigFuture” Scholarships
eligibility: U.S. high school juniors and seniors
overview: Earn scholarship entries by completing simple college planning steps, like building a college list or submitting the FAFSA. More actions = more chances to win.

name: Niche “No Essay” Scholarship
eligibility: Anyone planning to attend college
overview: Niche runs a straightforward $2,000 scholarship sweepstakes that takes just a minute to enter. Winners selected randomly each month.

name: Bold.org “No-Essay” Scholarships
eligibility: Varies by listing
overview: Bold.org offers dozens of no-essay scholarships you can apply for in minutes. Create a free profile and apply to as many as you like.

name: 2K Annual Drug Rehab USA – Mental Health Scholarship
eligibility: Students with a passion for mental health advocacy
overview: Submit an essay, video, or artwork sharing your passion for mental health and the difference you hope to make.

name: KC R. Sandidge Photography Scholarship
eligibility: High school seniors
overview: Submit 3–5 portfolio images on a selected theme. Open to aspiring student photographers.

name: Lewis Hollins Memorial Art Scholarship
eligibility: Students pursuing art
overview: For students pursuing art—especially watercolor, LGBTQ+, and underrepresented creatives encouraged to apply. Submit a sample of your work.

name: Doan Foundation Arts Scholarship
eligibility: Low-income high school seniors in California
overview: Supports students with a passion for the arts. Optional art submission encouraged.

name: Windward Spirit Scholarship
eligibility: Creative students
overview: Reflect on “Ode to Millennials–Gen Z” and respond through a creative written or artistic submission.

name: GoSkills Scholarship
eligibility: Women pursuing entrepreneurial goals
overview: Submit a short business plan and respond to open-ended questions about your ambitions.

name: National YoungArts Foundation
eligibility: U.S. students ages 15–18
overview: Recognizes excellence in visual, literary, and performing arts through portfolio or audition-based entries.

name: Andrew Flusche Scholarship Contest
eligibility: High school seniors and college students
overview: Submit a short video promoting safe and courteous driving. Open to high school seniors and college students.

name: 10x Digital Marketing Scholarship
eligibility: High school seniors or college students with a passion for digital marketing and community involvement
overview: Share how you’ve used digital platforms to promote good causes. Open to students pursuing marketing, communications, or related fields.

name: The Gloria Barron Prize for Young Heroes
eligibility: Ages 8–18
overview: Honors inspiring young leaders who’ve made a positive difference through service projects, environmental efforts, and community advocacy.

name: Don’t Text and Drive Scholarship
eligibility: Students committed to promoting safe driving
overview: Write a short statement about the risks of texting and driving—and your commitment to preventing it.

name: Becca’s Closet Spirit of Generosity Scholarship
eligibility: High school seniors with outstanding community service
overview: Recognizes students who demonstrate the generosity, kindness, and volunteerism that defined Becca’s legacy.

name: A Voice for Animals Essay Contest Scholarship
eligibility: Students who advocate for animal welfare
overview: Write about the importance of feline care or animal rescue and how it ties into your personal or academic goals.

name: Cirkled In “No Sweat” Scholarship
eligibility: Middle and high school students
overview: No essay required—just create a Cirkled In profile and highlight your extracurricular and volunteer experience.

name: Courage to Grow Scholarship
eligibility: High school juniors and seniors or current college students with a GPA of 2.5+
overview: Write a short essay on why you deserve this scholarship. Aimed at students with financial need and a drive to succeed.

name: Hispanic Scholarship Fund
eligibility: Students of Hispanic heritage with a GPA of 3.0+ (high school) or 2.5+ (college)
overview: One of the largest and most well-known scholarships for Latino students. Open to high school seniors, undergrads, and grad students.

name: The Gates Scholarship
amount: Full cost of attendance (after other aid)
eligibility: High-achieving, Pell-eligible, minority high school seniors
overview: Covers full unmet need for outstanding minority students pursuing a four-year degree. Highly competitive.

name: Ron Brown Scholar Program
eligibility: Black/African American high school seniors who demonstrate academic excellence, leadership, and community service
overview: One of the most prestigious scholarships for Black students in the U.S., supporting both financial and leadership development.

name: UNCF Scholarships
eligibility: Primarily for African American students; must attend a participating college or university
overview: UNCF offers hundreds of scholarships to support Black students in a wide range of majors and career paths.

name: We the Students Essay Contest
eligibility: U.S. high school students aged 14–19
overview: Write an essay exploring constitutional principles and civic engagement. Prizes awarded to multiple winners.

name: John F. Kennedy Profile in Courage Essay Contest
eligibility: U.S. high school students in grades 9–12
overview: Submit an original essay describing an act of political courage by a U.S. elected official. Well-regarded and competitive.

name: Driver Education Initiative Award – “In the Driver’s Seat”
eligibility: High school or college students in the U.S., Canada, or abroad
overview: Submit a 750+ word personal essay on safe driving. Judged for clarity, relevance, and personal insight.

name: Unigo $10K Scholarship
eligibility: U.S. students aged 14+ planning to attend a postsecondary institution
overview: Write a short essay answering whether you’d rather be smart, funny, or rich—and why. Creativity counts!

name: NurseRecruiter.com Scholarship
eligibility: Students accepted to or enrolled in an accredited nursing program
overview: Submit an essay on why you chose nursing and how you want to make a difference in healthcare.

name: Ed Bradley Scholarship
eligibility: Undergraduate students of color pursuing careers in journalism
overview: Requires a cover letter, essay, and 3–5 samples of your broadcast or digital reporting work.

name: Children of Fallen Patriots Foundation Scholarship
eligibility: Children of U.S. service members who died in the line of duty
overview: This foundation provides gap funding between other aid and the total cost of college for eligible children of fallen heroes.

name: Freedom Alliance Scholarship Fund
eligibility: Children of U.S. military personnel who were killed or permanently disabled in service
overview: Established to honor the bravery of service members and help their children access higher education.

name: ICMA-RC Public Employee Memorial Scholarship Fund
eligibility: Surviving children and spouses of local/state public employees who died in the line of duty
overview: Open to children of firefighters, police officers, and other public service workers attending an accredited institution.

name: Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation
eligibility: Children of U.S. Marines and Navy Corpsmen with financial need
overview: Supports students pursuing a post-secondary education, focusing on those with demonstrated financial need and academic promise.

name: Patriots Path Scholarship
eligibility: High school seniors in JROTC or undergraduates in ROTC with a 3.0+ GPA
overview: Designed for students preparing for a military career. Applicants must explain their goals and service motivations.

name: Billy Welu Scholarship
eligibility: College students who are active in bowling and maintain at least a 2.5 GPA
overview: Named after a professional bowler and commentator, this scholarship honors students who show sportsmanship and academic achievement.

name: Michael Moody Fitness Scholarship
eligibility: U.S. high school seniors, undergraduates, or graduate students pursuing health, wellness, or fitness careers
overview: For students passionate about promoting physical health and fitness—whether through athletics, education, or leadership.

name: Women’s Western Golf Foundation Scholarship
eligibility: Female high school seniors who have played competitive golf
overview: Based on academic achievement, excellence of character, and involvement in golf. Financial need is also considered.

name: Francis Ouimet Scholarship
eligibility: Massachusetts students with two+ years of golf service (as caddies or in course operations)
overview: Renewable for four years. Selection is based on academics, leadership, and golf involvement. Includes three required essays.

name: Rosalind P. Walter College Scholarship
eligibility: Students active in National Junior Tennis and Learning (NJTL)
overview: For students active in NJTL. Awarded over four years. Requires academic achievement, community service, and recommendations including one from a tennis mentor.

name: Dwight F. Davis Memorial Scholarship
eligibility: NJTL participants
overview: Honors the legacy of the Davis Cup’s founder. Open to NJTL participants who demonstrate strong academics, community service, and leadership. Four-year award.

name: PGA WORKS John & Tamara Lundgren Scholars Program
eligibility: Students pursuing PGA of America membership through PGA Golf Management programs
overview: Supports students pursuing PGA of America membership through PGA Golf Management programs. Focus on diversity and intent to work in the golf industry. One international-interest award is available.

name: USBC Chuck Hall Star of Tomorrow
eligibility: Bowling scholarship for high school seniors or college students under age 20. Must be a USBC member.
overview: Bowling scholarship for high school seniors or college students under age 20. Must be a USBC member. Judged on bowling performance, academics, and extracurricular involvement.
